Class GamePanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • gui.GamePanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GamePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

    Title: GamePanel

    Description: class which displays the words in order to play.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Diana Sighinolfi
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Detail

      • pos

        public static int pos
        Attribute that indicates one of the four positions in which the new word will be displayed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GamePanel

        public GamePanel()
        Constructor without parameters which instantiates a new game panel. It calls the super.constructor and add a new KeyListener.
        See Also:
        GPListener

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Method which paints all the components to the panel and therefore allows the game. It is called by the run() method continuously.
        Overrides:
        paint in class javax.swing.JComponent
        See Also:
        JComponent.paint(java.awt.Graphics)

      • getParole

        public StringWord getParole(int i)
        Gets the word at index i.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of word returned
        Returns:
        the string at i index of the array parole

      • setParole

        public void setParole(int i,
             StringWord value)
        Sets the i element of the array parole with a new string.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the word that has to been changed
        value - the string which contains the word

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex()
        Gets the number of words in game minus one.
        Returns:
        the number of words already creates during the game minus one

      • initializeIndex

        public void initializeIndex()
        Initialize index in order to begin a new level of game (there are no words displayed at the beginning of a new level).

      • initializeLev1

        public void initializeLev1()
        Initialize lev1 in order to begin a new level of game.

      • initializeDialog

        public void initializeDialog()
        Initialize dialog in order to begin a new level of game.

      • getAscissa

        public int getAscissa()
        Called on an instance of a StringWord gets the x-axis.
        Returns:
        the x-axis of a word

      • getOrdinata

        public int getOrdinata()
        Called on an instance of a StringWord gets the y-axis.
        Returns:
        the y-axis of a word

      • getWordManager

        public WordManager getWordManager()
        Gets the word manager reference associated with the game panel.
        Returns:
        the word manager

      • getGPL

        public GPListener getGPL()
        Gets the GPL.
        Returns:
        the KeyListener of the panel

      • closeDialog

        public void closeDialog()
        Method which close the dialog opened (the GameOver one or the Winner one).

      • setGo

        public void setGo(boolean go)
        Starts or stops the current game.
        Parameters:
        go - boolean which allows the game or stops it

      • increaseSpeed

        public void increaseSpeed()
        Increase the speed of the game.

      • run

        public void run()
        Method which runs the application in loop until the go is set to true. It calls paint(java.awt.Graphics) using repaint() and it pauses the current thread (Event Dispatch Thread) using the speed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if the thread couldn't been slept
        See Also:
        Component.repaint()
